newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil lower house to vote on oil bill priority.
newsitem.headline: Brazil lower house to vote on oil bill priority.

text.p: A bill opening up Brazil's petroleum industry will be put to a full vote in the Chamber of Deputies Wednesday if the lower house approves later Tuesday a motion giving the legislation priority treatment, a whip said.
Deputy Inocencio Oliveira, lower house leader of the government-allied Liberal Front Party (PFL), said the government wanted the oil bill through the Chamber of Deputies this week.
"We want to dedicate next week to administrative reform," Oliveira said, refering to a controversial constitutional amendment that would shake up Brazil's civil service.
The oil bill was approved earlier Tuesday by a lower house panel.
It would allow private companies to compete or enter joint-ventures with state oil and gas giant Petrobras, create a new sector regulator and end fuel price subsidies within three years.
